packageMeta.name: purescript-pathy
packageMeta.description: A type-safe abstraction for platform-independent file paths

declarations.comments: The (phantom) type of absolute paths.
declarations.title: Abs

declarations.comments: A type describing a directory whose location is absolutely specified.
declarations.title: AbsDir

declarations.comments: A type describing a file whose location is absolutely specified.
declarations.title: AbsFile

declarations.comments: A type describing an absolute file or directory path.
declarations.title: AbsPath

declarations.comments: The (phantom) type of directories.
declarations.title: Dir

declarations.comments: A newtype around a directory name.
declarations.title: DirName

declarations.comments: Escapers encode segments or characters which have reserved meaning.
declarations.title: Escaper

declarations.comments: The (phantom) type of files.
declarations.title: File

declarations.comments: A newtype around a file name.
declarations.title: FileName

declarations.comments:
A type that describes a Path. All flavors of paths are described by this
type, whether they are absolute or relative paths, whether they
refer to files or directories, whether they are sandboxed or not.

* The type parameter `a` describes whether the path is `Rel` or `Abs`.
* The type parameter `b` describes whether the path is `File` or `Dir`.
* The type parameter `s` describes whether the path is `Sandboxed` or `Unsandboxed`.

To ensure type safety, there is no way for users to create a value of
this type directly. Instead, helpers should be used, such as `rootDir`,
`currentDir`, `file`, `dir`,  `(</>)`, and `parsePath`.

This ADT allows invalid paths (e.g. paths inside files), but there is no
possible way for such paths to be constructed by user-land code. The only
"invalid path" that may be constructed is using the `parentDir'` function, e.g.
`parentDir' rootDir`, or by parsing an equivalent string such as `/../`,
but such paths are marked as unsandboxed, and may not be rendered to strings
until they are first sandboxed to some directory.
declarations.title: Path

declarations.comments: A type describing a file or directory path.
declarations.title: AnyPath

declarations.comments: The (phantom) type of relative paths.
declarations.title: Rel

declarations.comments:
A type describing a directory whose location is given relative to some
other, unspecified directory (referred to as the "current directory").
declarations.title: RelDir

declarations.comments:
A type describing a file whose location is given relative to some other,
unspecified directory (referred to as the "current directory").
declarations.title: RelFile

declarations.comments: A type describing a relative file or directory path.
declarations.title: RelPath

declarations.comments: The (phantom) type of sandboxed paths.
declarations.title: Sandboxed

declarations.comments: The (phantom) type of unsandboxed paths.
declarations.title: Unsandboxed

declarations.comments: Given a directory path, appends either a file or directory to the path.
declarations.title: appendPath

declarations.comments:
Sets the extension of the file to the specified extension.

```purescript
file "image" <.> "png"
```
declarations.title: setExtension

declarations.comments:
Ascends into the parent of the specified directory, then descends into
the specified path. The result is always unsandboxed because it may escape
its previous sandbox.
declarations.title: parentAppend

declarations.comments: Unwraps the `DirName` newtype.
declarations.title: runDirName

declarations.comments: Unwraps the `FileName` newtype.
declarations.title: runFileName

declarations.comments: Canonicalizes a path, by reducing things in the form `/x/../` to just `/x/`.
declarations.title: canonicalize

declarations.comments: Changes the extension on a file name.
declarations.title: changeExtension

declarations.comments: The "current directory", which can be used to define relatively-located resources.
declarations.title: currentDir

declarations.comments:
Returns the depth of the path. This may be negative in some cases, e.g.
`./../../../` has depth `-3`.
declarations.title: depth

declarations.comments: Creates a path which points to a relative directory of the specified name.
declarations.title: dir

declarations.comments: Creates a path which points to a relative directory of the specified name.
declarations.title: dir'

declarations.comments:
Retrieves the name of a directory path. Not all paths have such a name,
for example, the root or current directory.
declarations.title: dirName

declarations.comments: Drops the extension on a file name.
declarations.title: dropExtension

declarations.comments: Retrieves the extension of a file name.
declarations.title: extension

declarations.comments: Creates a path which points to a relative file of the specified name.
declarations.title: file

declarations.comments: Creates a path which points to a relative file of the specified name.
declarations.title: file'

declarations.comments: Retrieves the name of a file path.
declarations.title: fileName

declarations.comments:
Determines if two paths have the exact same representation. Note that
two paths may represent the same path even if they have different
representations!
declarations.title: identicalPath

declarations.comments: Determines if this path is absolutely located.
declarations.title: isAbsolute

declarations.comments: Determines if this path is relatively located.
declarations.title: isRelative

declarations.comments: Determines if the path is absolutely specified.
declarations.title: maybeAbs

declarations.comments: Determines if the path refers to a directory.
declarations.title: maybeDir

declarations.comments: Determines if the path refers to a file.
declarations.title: maybeFile

declarations.comments: Determines if the path is relatively specified.
declarations.title: maybeRel

declarations.comments:
Attempts to extract out the parent directory of the specified path. If the
function would have to use a relative path in the return value, the function will
instead return `Nothing`.
declarations.title: parentDir

declarations.comments:
Creates a path that points to the parent directory of the specified path.
This function always unsandboxes the path.
declarations.title: parentDir'

declarations.comments:
Peels off the last directory and the terminal file or directory name
from the path. Returns `Nothing` if there is no such pair (for example,
if the last path segment is root directory, current directory, or parent
directory).
declarations.title: peel

declarations.comments:
An escaper that removes all slashes, converts ".." into "$dot$dot", and
converts "." into "$dot".
declarations.title: posixEscaper

declarations.comments:
Parses a canonical `String` representation of a path into a `Path` value.
Note that in order to be unambiguous, trailing directories should be
marked with a trailing slash character (`'/'`).
declarations.title: parsePath

declarations.comments: Attempts to parse an absolute directory from a string.
declarations.title: parseAbsDir

declarations.comments: Attempts to parse an absolute file from a string.
declarations.title: parseAbsFile

declarations.comments: Attempts to parse a relative directory from a string.
declarations.title: parseRelDir

declarations.comments: Attempts to parse a relative file from a string.
declarations.title: parseRelFile

declarations.comments:
Prints a `Path` into its canonical `String` representation. For security
reasons, the path must be sandboxed before it can be rendered to a string.
declarations.title: printPath

declarations.comments:
Prints a `Path` into its canonical `String` representation, using the
specified escaper to escape special characters in path segments. For
security reasons, the path must be sandboxed before rendering to string.
declarations.title: printPath'

declarations.comments: Refines path segments but does not change anything else.
declarations.title: refine

declarations.comments:
Makes one path relative to another reference path, if possible, otherwise
returns `Nothing`. The returned path inherits the sandbox settings of the
reference path.

Note there are some cases this function cannot handle.
declarations.title: relativeTo

declarations.comments:
Renames a directory path. Note: This is a simple rename of the terminal
directory name, not a "move".
declarations.title: renameDir

declarations.comments: Renames a file path.
declarations.title: renameFile

declarations.comments: The root directory, which can be used to define absolutely-located resources.
declarations.title: rootDir

declarations.comments: Given an escaper and a segment to encode, returns the encoded segment.
declarations.title: runEscaper

declarations.comments:
Attempts to sandbox a path relative to some directory. If successful, the sandboxed
directory will be returned relative to the sandbox directory (although this can easily
be converted into an absolute path using `</>`).

This combinator can be used to ensure that paths which originate from user-code
cannot access data outside a given directory.
declarations.title: sandbox

declarations.comments: Unsandboxes any path (whether sandboxed or not).
declarations.title: unsandbox
